definition: to wake sb up with a noise
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
to wake up/to be awake/to become aware/to sober up/to come to

sentences.english: He complained in a querulous voice about having been woken up.
sentences.chinese: 他用不耐煩的聲音埋怨別人吵醒了他。

sentences.english: Those fast asleep people were waked up by the terrible screams.
sentences.chinese: 熟睡着的人們都被可怕的尖叫聲吵醒了。

sentences.english: I crept back to bed, but was awakened later by low voices saying good-bye.
sentences.chinese: 我悄悄溜回牀上，但是後來被低聲的告別聲繪吵醒。

sentences.english: That was what kept waking me up during the show.
sentences.chinese: 就是它在演出的過程中不停地把我吵醒。

sentences.english: Don't talk so loud — you'll wake the whole street.
sentences.chinese: 別那麼大聲說話，你快把左鄰右舍都吵醒了。

sentences.english: She was afraid of waking the child.
Today, I awoke to the sound of my dad knocking on my dorm room door for a surprise visit.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我被我老爸俄然拜訪我宿舍的拍門聲所吵醒。

sentences.english: We were awakened by the whimpers of the sick puppy.
sentences.chinese: 生病小狗的哀叫聲將我們吵醒了。

sentences.english: He was disturbed and awakened by the radio.
The baby was made awake by the door suddenly shutting.
sentences.chinese: 這個嬰兒被猛烈的關門聲吵醒。

sentences.english: A hideous evil has awoken in the Forgotten Realms.
sentences.chinese: 一個醜陋邪惡吵醒，在被遺忘的境界。

sentences.english: I am awaked almost every night by the panting of the locomotive. It interrupts my dreams.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎每晚，我都被機車的聲音吵醒，它侵擾我的夢境。

sentences.english: I'm such a heavy sleeper that the explosion didn't wake me.
sentences.chinese: 我睡得很死，連爆炸聲都沒有把我吵醒。

sentences.english: Noise does not rouse a drunken man; silence awakens him.
sentences.chinese: 喧囂不曾吵醒一個醉漢。

sentences.english: He’d got under the duvet, hoping his movements would wake her.
sentences.chinese: 他縮回被窩裏並希望自己的這些動作能夠吵醒她。

definition: to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to rouse/to be woken by sth/to wake with a start/to sleep lightly
